New York University Archives
Hemispheric Institute Digital Video Library Archived Website
Hemispheric Institute of Performance and Politics
New York University. Libraries
RG.38.30
1 websites in 1 archived website.
March 2018 The Hemispheric Institute Digital Video Library, established in 2005, is a partnership with NYU Libraries to preserve and provide access to the digital library of the Hemispheric Institute. The library is made up of video of political performance practices in the Americas dating back to the 1970s.
Historical Note
The Hemispheric Institute Digital Video Library was established in 2005 in collaboration with NYU Libraries and the Hemispheric Institute. In Spring 2021, the website redirected to the Bobcat library catalog.
Scope and Contents
The Hemispheric Institute Digital Video Library, established in 2005, is a partnership with NYU Libraries to preserve and provide access to the digital library of the Hemispheric Institute. The library is made up of video of political performance practices in the Americas dating back to the 1970s. The website consists of artist profiles selected for preservation in the digital library. Artists include the American Indian Community House, Astrid Hadad, Colectivo Acciones de Arte, Carmelita Tropicana, Catalinas Sur, Circus Amok, Coatlicue Theatre Company, Dancing Earth, Danny Hoch, Deborah Hunt/MASKHUNT, Diana Raznovich, El Hábito, El Teatro Campesino, Enrique Buenaventura, Fortaleza de la Mujer Maya, Fulana, Guillermo Gomez-Peña & La Pocha Nostra, Hip-Hop Theater Festival (Hi-ARTS), Javier Cardona, Jesusa Rodríguez, Latina Theatre Lab, Liliana Felipe, Malayerba, Manuel Mendive, Mapa Teatro, Marianela Boán, Mujeres Creando, Mujeres Creando Comunidad, Nao Bustamante, New WORLD Theater, Nicolás Dumit Estévez and Collaborators, Pregones Theater, Richard Schechner, Rosa Luisa Márquez & Theatre Collaborators, Spiderwoman Theater, Split Britches, Susana Cook, Teatro Buendía, Teatro Jornalero Sin Fronteras, Teatro La Candelaria, Teatro La Máscara, Teatro Oficina, Teatro Experimental de Cali, Teresa Hernández, Tim Miller, Tribo de Atuadores Ói Nóis Aqui Traveiz, UNIVERSES, Viveca Vázquez, Yuyachkani, and Zeca Ligiéro/NEPAA. Artist profiles generally consisted of a listing and descriptions of works, resources, public interventions, and interviews related to the artists.
Take Down Policy
Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.
If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.
Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.
Arrangement
The collection is not arranged.
Preferred Citation
To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; Hemispheric Institute Digital Video Library Archived Website; RG 38.30; Wayback URL; New York University Archives, New York University.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Appraisal
Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of http://hidvl.nyu.edu/ in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints. Video was excluded from the crawl.
Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored with the permission of the content owner.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
The website was selected for capture by Bess Pittman in March 2018. There is no accession number associated with this website.
Processing Information
In March 2018, the website was selected to be part of the DLTS: Migrating Sites Web Archive in 2018. In Spring 2023, a finding aid was created for RG 38.30.
Related Materials
Records of the Hemispheric Institute for Performance and Politics (RG 37.45)
Digitized videos in the Hemispheric Instiute Digital Video Library are available via the Bobcat Catalog.
Library materials -- Digitization. Performance art -- Latin America. Art -- Political aspects -- Latin America Art -- Social aspects -- Latin America Social movements in art.
